edu.du.penrose.systems.fedoraApp
Class ProgramProperties

java.lang.Object
  edu.du.penrose.systems.fedoraApp.ProgramProperties
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProgramFileProperties
public abstract class ProgramProperties
extends java.lang.Object

Manages multiple properties files used by the application using a java.util.Properties object.
Provides the interface for saving and retrieving properties that describe and control the current application.

Author:
chet.rebman

Method Detail

getProperty

public abstract java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key)
Get the property from the underlying storage medium. If the storage medium or the field/value does not exist null is returned. If the key is null, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
key - the field for the desired value
Returns:
value for the field

getProperty

public abstract boolean getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                    boolean defaultValue)
                             throws PropertyStorageException
Get the property from the underlying storage medium. If the storage medium or the field/value does not exist the default value is returned. If the key is null, return default value.

Parameters:
key - the field name.
defaultValue - if the field does not exist, set this as default.
Returns:
value the keys value
Throws:
PropertyStorageException

                                             java.lang.String defaultValue)
                                      throws PropertyStorageException
Get the property from the underlying storage medium. If the storage medium or the field/value does not exist the default value is returned. If the key is null, return default value.

Parameters:
key - the field for the desired value
defaultValue - if the field does not exist, set this as default.
Returns:
value the keys value
Throws:
PropertyStorageException

removeProperty

public abstract void removeProperty(java.lang.String key)
Remove the property field and it's value from the underlying storage medium. If the storage medium or the field/value does not exist no error is returned.

Parameters:
key - the property to remove.

saveProperty

public abstract void saveProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                  java.lang.String value)
                           throws PropertyStorageException
Save the field and it's value to the underlying storage medium, Make sure you set the file header first!

Parameters:
key - the property.
value - the properties value.
Throws:
PropertyStorageException - if unable to save to storage medium.
See Also:
setHeader(String)

getInstance

public static ProgramProperties getInstance(java.net.URL propertiesFileURL)
Manages multiple properties files used by the application using a java.util.Properties object. This method acts as a factory that returns an instance that gives access to the program properties at the specified URL. The Properties for a URL is stored in a static map once it is created for use through out the life of the application.

Parameters:
propertiesFileURL - location of the program properties resource.
Returns:
the application ProgramProperties
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - on any error.

getInstance

public static ProgramProperties getInstance(java.net.URL propertiesFileURL,
                                            java.lang.String fileHeader)
Create a new ProgramProperties which uses the supplied header. NOTE: will not be written until you actually save a property!

Parameters:
propertiesFileURL - location of the program properties resource.
fileHeader - new header for the ProgramProperties
Returns:
the application ProgramProperties
See Also:
getInstance(URL)

setHeader

public abstract void setHeader(java.lang.String header)
Set the header for the properties file.
NOTE: will not be written until you actually save a property!

Parameters:
header - the header to set

getPropertyNames

public abstract java.util.Enumeration getPropertyNames()
Returns an enumeration of all the keys in this property list, including distinct keys in the default property list if a key of the same name has not already been found from the main properties list.

Returns:
enumeration

getPropertyNamesAsArray

public abstract java.lang.String[] getPropertyNamesAsArray()
Get the property names in a String array.

Returns:
String array of property names.

getPropertyNamesAsOrderedArray

public abstract java.lang.String[] getPropertyNamesAsOrderedArray()
                                                           throws java.lang.Exception
This uses the properties values to set the order for the property names.
We assume the each property has a number as its value. This number is used to order the results.
No assumptions are made a correct properties file is assumed.

Returns:
array of ordered property names.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any error.
